I've been using TestNG for more unit and integration tests. However, I've
found that JUnit 4 and its eclipse plugin works faster and nicer. So I've
decided change all my unit tests to JUnit. 

I have a runUnitTests ant target that is used to run (previously) the
test-ng tests that are marked as "UnitTests"

As a start, I have changed this ant target to run all tests in my tests
target directory (i.e. using **/*.class)

What I thought would happen was that JUnit would look at these classes, find
the ones that are marked with the JUnit 4 @Test annotation and run them.

What I'm finding however is that it is attempting to run EVERY class in that
folder as a test and they are either Test-NG tests or just other utility
classes. As a result, JUnit is throwing errors

e.g.
Running au.tributech.tuxedo.beans.entity.PermissionTest$1
    [junit] Tests run: 2, Failures: 0, Errors: 2, Time elapsed: 0.017 sec
    [junit] Test au.tributech.tuxedo.beans.entity.PermissionTest$1 FAILED
    [junit] Running
au.tributech.tuxedo.beans.entity.PermissionTest$PermissionDescendant
    [junit] Tests run: 2, Failures: 0, Errors: 2, Time elapsed: 0.018 sec
    [junit] Test
au.tributech.tuxedo.beans.entity.PermissionTest$PermissionDescendant FAILED

Is there any way out of the box to make Junit just run the tests that use
org.junit.Test annoations ??

What I have got working (but its slow) is to write a custom ANT selector. 
<batchtest fork="yes" todir="${test.report.dir}">
  <fileset dir="${test.fixtures.dir}" includes="**/*.class">
    <custom classname="au.tributech.ant.JUnit4Selector"
classpathref="project.test.run.classpath"/>
  </fileset>
</batchtest>

The JUnit4Selector class I wrote simply reads in each file processed and
uses ASM-3.0 to look for JUnit4 annotations (@Test, @RunsWith etc..). If
they exist it processes that file otherwise skips it.

This works but it is pretty slow and I can see it being painfully slow when
there are hundreds of unit tests.

Surely I'm missing something here and JUnit's ANT task is smarter than what
it is appearing. I don't want to have to specify EVERY unit test when I add
them. That is just a maintenance nightmare.

Thanks for any pointers
